KH.content: backwards steps (retours en arrière), rhythm of Timaeus, go beyond, under philosophical logos, normal couple, to a third, a bastard, hybrid, orphan (khōra) > necessary but not true
KH.linkedContent: backwards steps (retours en arrière), rhythm of Timaeus, go beyond, under philosophical logos, normal couple, to a third, a bastard, hybrid, orphan (khōra) > necessary but not true

GT.content: Derrida “apologizes” for long detour, explains that it marks the step of 2 men in “Counterfeit Money,” rhythm of every incalculable scene of the gift
GT.linkedContent: Derrida “apologizes” for long detour, explains that it marks the step of 2 men in “Counterfeit Money,” rhythm of every incalculable scene of the gift

MONL.content: I try to impart a tone, rhythm
MONL.linkedContent: I try to impart a tone, rhythm

H.content: delay and haste, halting and hastening, rhythm of Oedipus’ journey
H.linkedContent: delay and haste, halting and hastening, rhythm of Oedipus’ journey

LOBL.content: the suspensive arrêt arrests the decisive arrêt and vice versa, the arrêt de mort arrests the arrêt de mort, arrhythmic pulsation of title [Blanchot’s] before it scatters like sand, in stopping (s’arrêtant) (as arrêt), it gives movement, sets in motion [prime mover]
LOBL.linkedContent: the suspensive arrêt arrests the decisive arrêt and vice versa, the arrêt de mort arrests the arrêt de mort, arrhythmic pulsation of title [Blanchot’s] before it scatters like sand, in stopping (s’arrêtant) (as arrêt), it gives movement, sets in motion [prime mover]

LOBL.content: death sentence, instant as elusive as last grain of sand in hourglass, death as result of dissemination of rhythm of life w/ no coup d’arrêt, unbordered/unbounded arrhythmy on beach that’s continuation of a sea: her pulse “scattered like sand”
LOBL.linkedContent: death sentence, instant as elusive as last grain of sand in hourglass, death as result of dissemination of rhythm of life w/ no coup d’arrêt, unbordered/unbounded arrhythmy on beach that’s continuation of a sea: her pulse “scattered like sand”

SPOM.content: “frequency counts”: experience of the ghost as a rhythm, insistence
SPOM.linkedContent: “frequency counts”: experience of the ghost as a rhythm, insistence

SPOM.content: Marx is not just pointing, “he’s taking the pulse of history,” “listening to a revolutionary frequency”
SPOM.linkedContent: Marx is not just pointing, “he’s taking the pulse of history,” “listening to a revolutionary frequency”

POOF.content: via & beyond Schmitt, der geschwisterlichen Klang (the brotherly-sisterly sound), the obscure friendship of rhyme, insane linking (appariement) of a couple, sense is born in a pair > before being philosophical, friendship concerns gift of the poem, isn’t there always a politics of a rhyme? > the rhyme can also become a traffic signal (philautie of linkage) > nothing looks more like the traffic signals of one country than those of another: this is the law > everything begins w/ Echo: rhymes sign, in cadence they seal a belonging, an ‘open gate’ [?]
POOF.linkedContent: via & beyond Schmitt, der geschwisterlichen Klang (the brotherly-sisterly sound), the obscure friendship of rhyme, insane linking (appariement) of a couple, sense is born in a pair > before being philosophical, friendship concerns gift of the poem, isn’t there always a politics of a rhyme? > the rhyme can also become a traffic signal (philautie of linkage) > nothing looks more like the traffic signals of one country than those of another: this is the law > everything begins w/ Echo: rhymes sign, in cadence they seal a belonging, an ‘open gate’ [?]

POR.content: strategic rhythm of new [professorial?] responsibility: multiple sites (lieux), rhythm of blinking eye (d’un battement de paupières), play one risk off other, la clôture contre l’abîme, l’abîme contre la clôture [hard eye (of reason) has no rhythm, no heart beat, no arrêt of sur-vie]
POR.linkedContent: strategic rhythm of new [professorial?] responsibility: multiple sites (lieux), rhythm of blinking eye (d’un battement de paupières), play one risk off other, la clôture contre l’abîme, l’abîme contre la clôture [hard eye (of reason) has no rhythm, no heart beat, no arrêt of sur-vie]

MPM.content: [see p. 88n at what speed ought one to read?] motif of precipitousness in de Man, acceleration to win time, win time over, non-dialectical—not a particular rhythm—a rhythm w/out rhythm (incommensurable acceleration, infinite and null, touches the sublime)
MPM.linkedContent: [see p. 88n at what speed ought one to read?] motif of precipitousness in de Man, acceleration to win time, win time over, non-dialectical—not a particular rhythm—a rhythm w/out rhythm (incommensurable acceleration, infinite and null, touches the sublime)

MSUBJ.content: under the words (mots), hors sens, when you let attraction of words, motifs, motets [anthems] play under the meaning, you draw, sing, rather than speaking, you write the unwritable > this passage also convokes multiplicity of voices in a “motel,” rhythm, vibration
MSUBJ.linkedContent: under the words (mots), hors sens, when you let attraction of words, motifs, motets [anthems] play under the meaning, you draw, sing, rather than speaking, you write the unwritable > this passage also convokes multiplicity of voices in a “motel,” rhythm, vibration

MSUBJ.content: to speak of the subjectile, we must speak by insertion and precipitation, acceleration of rhythmical projection [see MPM p. 62] and inscription of projectile, beyond “words and images”
MSUBJ.linkedContent: to speak of the subjectile, we must speak by insertion and precipitation, acceleration of rhythmical projection [see MPM p. 62] and inscription of projectile, beyond “words and images”

PAS.content: Blanchot’s strange rhythm of near and fear, of pas, ce démarche, imprints itself on (à) our discourse, chooses words
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot’s strange rhythm of near and fear, of pas, ce démarche, imprints itself on (à) our discourse, chooses words

PAS.content: the inner rhythm of sauf (contamination), always altered, always unscathed, “j’ai tout, sauf…” > “sauf que je voudrais en être débarrassé”
PAS.linkedContent: the inner rhythm of sauf (contamination), always altered, always unscathed, “j’ai tout, sauf…” > “sauf que je voudrais en être débarrassé”

FSW.content: most interesting analogy of Mystic Pad is time, discontinuous time, time as spacing, withdrawal of perception, periodic non-excitability > interruption/restoration of contact
FSW.linkedContent: most interesting analogy of Mystic Pad is time, discontinuous time, time as spacing, withdrawal of perception, periodic non-excitability > interruption/restoration of contact

T.content: intro to differance, cites, repercusses its rhythm w/out measure, incision conduite par une main aveugle pour n’avoir jamais vu que le part-et-d’autre d’un tissu > to weave (tramer) doesn’t play le jeu d’enchaînement, il joue l’enchaînement, trouer, traverser, works on both sides (le part-et-d’autre), leaves ear canal open, sous le coup d’un enchaînement simulé, non-echo
T.linkedContent: intro to differance, cites, repercusses its rhythm w/out measure, incision conduite par une main aveugle pour n’avoir jamais vu que le part-et-d’autre d’un tissu > to weave (tramer) doesn’t play le jeu d’enchaînement, il joue l’enchaînement, trouer, traverser, works on both sides (le part-et-d’autre), leaves ear canal open, sous le coup d’un enchaînement simulé, non-echo

SH.content: poet is provoked, constituted, by the hour, its caesuras > poetic rhythm or spacing at heart of origin of meaning, meaning of language
SH.linkedContent: poet is provoked, constituted, by the hour, its caesuras > poetic rhythm or spacing at heart of origin of meaning, meaning of language

DS.content: what ruins the “pious capital letter,” the aplomb of the heading: the blanks, ordered return of white spaces, measure & order of dissemination, law of spacing, rhythmos, invisible fleuron
DS.linkedContent: what ruins the “pious capital letter,” the aplomb of the heading: the blanks, ordered return of white spaces, measure & order of dissemination, law of spacing, rhythmos, invisible fleuron

DS.content: temporal dislocation in hymen baffles decidability of different terms: is there even time, tenses, temporal differences, when there’s no central present/referent?
DS.linkedContent: temporal dislocation in hymen baffles decidability of different terms: is there even time, tenses, temporal differences, when there’s no central present/referent?

DS.content: rhythm as hymen (Dream?), “center of vibratory suspense”: soir, noir, noire, miroir, ivoire
hymen: not truth of unveiling: no alētheia, only wink of hymen: rhythmic fall, regular (w)inclined cadence (une cadence inclinée)
DS.linkedContent: hymen: not truth of unveiling: no alētheia, only wink of hymen: rhythmic fall, regular (w)inclined cadence (une cadence inclinée)

DS.content: hymen, one of those “beneficent figures” engendered by “the opposition btwn the closed and the open”: i.e. the fan, the book, the dancer
DS.linkedContent: hymen, one of those “beneficent figures” engendered by “the opposition btwn the closed and the open”: i.e. the fan, the book, the dancer

DS.content: rhyme, general law of textual effects: folding together of identity & difference
DS.linkedContent: rhyme, general law of textual effects: folding together of identity & difference

DS.content: [quoting Mallarmé] rhythm, literary game par excellence: mimic suspense/laughter—rhythmic cadence, or case, all the falls, the silent fall of pen
DS.linkedContent: [quoting Mallarmé] rhythm, literary game par excellence: mimic suspense/laughter—rhythmic cadence, or case, all the falls, the silent fall of pen

P.content: Hegel’s ternary rhythm—what he calls a “ring”—encircles, links to other rings: in science of beautiful, mind presupposes, anticipates itself > philosophy of art: circle in circle of circles
P.linkedContent: Hegel’s ternary rhythm—what he calls a “ring”—encircles, links to other rings: in science of beautiful, mind presupposes, anticipates itself > philosophy of art: circle in circle of circles

POS.content: Democrites’ rhythmos as writing & rhythm, a materialism before Marx [?], repressed, silenced, ontologized by Plato
POS.linkedContent: Democrites’ rhythmos as writing & rhythm, a materialism before Marx [?], repressed, silenced, ontologized by Plato

ROP.content: double bind drives deconstruction in rhythmic compulsion to track desire for origin, and to raise its stakes, la pousse à une surenchère > interminable drama of analysis, il fallait faire droit to the law deconstructed, w/ une affirmation donatrice unknown to yet driving analysis
ROP.linkedContent: double bind drives deconstruction in rhythmic compulsion to track desire for origin, and to raise its stakes, la pousse à une surenchère > interminable drama of analysis, il fallait faire droit to the law deconstructed, w/ une affirmation donatrice unknown to yet driving analysis

SP.content: not only keep your distance from woman, game of seduction, but woman as non-figure, non-identity, distance’s very chasm, interval’s cadence, distance itself [which can’t be said]
SP.linkedContent: not only keep your distance from woman, game of seduction, but woman as non-figure, non-identity, distance’s very chasm, interval’s cadence, distance itself [which can’t be said]

SP.content: regular, rhythmic blindness takes place in Nietzsche’s text, he’s lost there too > il y a de la perte, dès qu’il y a hymen
SP.linkedContent: regular, rhythmic blindness takes place in Nietzsche’s text, he’s lost there too > il y a de la perte, dès qu’il y a hymen

O.content: le détour d’une écriture dont one ne revient pas, dissemination: this question calls for restaging of arithmos, “counting” as “bad procedure,” and rereading the rhythmos of Democritus, which philosophy has never been able to reckon w/ (n’aura pu compter) > philosophy accounts for itself by rising out of, and then circulating w/in its speculative necessity, the [envelope of writing]
O.linkedContent: le détour d’une écriture dont one ne revient pas, dissemination: this question calls for restaging of arithmos, “counting” as “bad procedure,” and rereading the rhythmos of Democritus, which philosophy has never been able to reckon w/ (n’aura pu compter) > philosophy accounts for itself by rising out of, and then circulating w/in its speculative necessity, the [envelope of writing]

O.content: “la dissémination (se) produit (dans) cela : coupe de plaisir” > il rythme et le plaisir et la répétition selon une coupe multiple > il [text, literature, the beyond of the whole] imprime pourtant au tout, depuis le “dedans” du système où il marque ses effets de colonne vide et inscrite, un mouvement de fiction
O.linkedContent: “la dissémination (se) produit (dans) cela : coupe de plaisir” > il rythme et le plaisir et la répétition selon une coupe multiple > il [text, literature, the beyond of the whole] imprime pourtant au tout, depuis le “dedans” du système où il marque ses effets de colonne vide et inscrite, un mouvement de fiction

DPi.content: anesthetize DP (follows rhythm of nighttime up until dawn) like nocturnal council (dawn, fascination, theater, coldness of machine)
DPi.linkedContent: anesthetize DP (follows rhythm of nighttime up until dawn) like nocturnal council (dawn, fascination, theater, coldness of machine)

TB.content: rhythm, twists & turns from abyss to abyss, deconstructs the tower > madness on both sides (interior/exterior limit) > impossible task: the infinite guilt absolves you immediately
TB.linkedContent: rhythm, twists & turns from abyss to abyss, deconstructs the tower > madness on both sides (interior/exterior limit) > impossible task: the infinite guilt absolves you immediately

Gii.content: to ask about paths (odoi) of Heidegger, his step (pas) and rhythm, his Hand-werk of writing—questions beyond method (d’outre-méthode)
Gii.linkedContent: to ask about paths (odoi) of Heidegger, his step (pas) and rhythm, his Hand-werk of writing—questions beyond method (d’outre-méthode)

Gii.content: Gedicht: place toward which poems tend acc. a “rhythm” > unspoken, unique Ort
Gii.linkedContent: Gedicht: place toward which poems tend acc. a “rhythm” > unspoken, unique Ort

REST.content: the pas de contact (pas de sujet) of Van Gogh’s shoes, a detachment whose reattachment is sought in its fundamental surface, the sole, or the fundamental subjectivity of the ground
REST.linkedContent: the pas de contact (pas de sujet) of Van Gogh’s shoes, a detachment whose reattachment is sought in its fundamental surface, the sole, or the fundamental subjectivity of the ground

REST.content: pas de contact, rhythmically, makes marche, pas is not present nor absent ——pas works (marche) badly w/out a pair
REST.linkedContent: pas de contact, rhythmically, makes marche, pas is not present nor absent ——pas works (marche) badly w/out a pair

DST.content: necessity of rhythm: necessity of a scansion that comes to fold & unfold thought
DST.linkedContent: necessity of rhythm: necessity of a scansion that comes to fold & unfold thought

DST.content: thinking of translation, experience of thinking itself, its most essential & risky passage, where experience of thinking is also poetic experience: privileged examples (in Lacoue-Labarthe): Gestell, mimesis, rhuthmos
DST.linkedContent: thinking of translation, experience of thinking itself, its most essential & risky passage, where experience of thinking is also poetic experience: privileged examples (in Lacoue-Labarthe): Gestell, mimesis, rhuthmos

DST.content: insistent return of motif traces silhouette of unity, more a rhythm than a configuration
DST.linkedContent: insistent return of motif traces silhouette of unity, more a rhythm than a configuration

DST.content: thus Lacoue-Labarthe’s “style,” ethos, multiplying parentheses, rhythm of warnings, which don’t protect anyone > warning stands watch so no one will fail to expose oneself
DST.linkedContent: thus Lacoue-Labarthe’s “style,” ethos, multiplying parentheses, rhythm of warnings, which don’t protect anyone > warning stands watch so no one will fail to expose oneself

DST.content: in the beginning was rhythm, said von Bülow, no simple beginning; Lacoue-Labarthe: “différence-à-soi répétée du Même” > no rhythm w/out repetition, spacing, caesura
DST.linkedContent: in the beginning was rhythm, said von Bülow, no simple beginning; Lacoue-Labarthe: “différence-à-soi répétée du Même” > no rhythm w/out repetition, spacing, caesura

DST.content: we are constituted by this rhythm, (de-)constituted by marks of this “caesuraed” stamp, rhythmotypy as divided idiom in us of désistance > no subject w/out signature of this rhythm
DST.linkedContent: we are constituted by this rhythm, (de-)constituted by marks of this “caesuraed” stamp, rhythmotypy as divided idiom in us of désistance > no subject w/out signature of this rhythm

DST.content: rhythm: to think désistance as it is written
DST.linkedContent: rhythm: to think désistance as it is written

DST.content: rhythm: spaced repetition of a percussion, inscriptive force (insensible) of a spacing > doesn’t belong to visible/audible figuration—still structures them (rhythmotypical, typorhythmic)
DST.linkedContent: rhythm: spaced repetition of a percussion, inscriptive force (insensible) of a spacing > doesn’t belong to visible/audible figuration—still structures them (rhythmotypical, typorhythmic)

DST.content: Nietzsche: to mistake rhythm of the sentence, to mistake the very meaning of the sentence
DST.linkedContent: Nietzsche: to mistake rhythm of the sentence, to mistake the very meaning of the sentence

DST.content: though Heidegger recalled that Georgiades translated rhuthmos as Gepräge (imprint, seal, type, character), this didn’t prevent him from bringing typos back to ontotypology & subject back to epoch of subjectity
DST.linkedContent: though Heidegger recalled that Georgiades translated rhuthmos as Gepräge (imprint, seal, type, character), this didn’t prevent him from bringing typos back to ontotypology & subject back to epoch of subjectity

DST.content: Hölderlin: all is rhythm (Rhythmus), destiny of man a single celestial rhythm
DST.linkedContent: Hölderlin: all is rhythm (Rhythmus), destiny of man a single celestial rhythm

DST.content: Mallarmé: every soul is a rhythmic knot
DST.linkedContent: Mallarmé: every soul is a rhythmic knot

DST.content: Derrida says that no dialectic can overcome (ne saurait venir à bout) double constraint, double law, that of knot & caesura, obligation & cut (i.e. rhythm) > but then wonders if double bind is too dialectical, so he thinks of an arrythmic gap, hiatus, caesura, another undecidable
DST.linkedContent: Derrida says that no dialectic can overcome (ne saurait venir à bout) double constraint, double law, that of knot & caesura, obligation & cut (i.e. rhythm) > but then wonders if double bind is too dialectical, so he thinks of an arrythmic gap, hiatus, caesura, another undecidable

DST.content: un autre indécidable, the gap/hiatus in an undecidable derived from dialectical calculation/contraction, arrhythmic caesura as respiration of rhythm (this necessity awaits us) [pas, heartbeat]
DST.linkedContent: un autre indécidable, the gap/hiatus in an undecidable derived from dialectical calculation/contraction, arrhythmic caesura as respiration of rhythm (this necessity awaits us) [pas, heartbeat]

DST.content: for Lacoue-Labarthe [?], anyone linked to edge of madness (au bord de la folie), the autobiographical (allobiographical) adventure, and its doubles, and the other, and death, is concerned w/ rhythm (the musical obsession) (Nietzsche, Hölderlin, Rousseau, Reik, Mallarmé)
DST.linkedContent: for Lacoue-Labarthe [?], anyone linked to edge of madness (au bord de la folie), the autobiographical (allobiographical) adventure, and its doubles, and the other, and death, is concerned w/ rhythm (the musical obsession) (Nietzsche, Hölderlin, Rousseau, Reik, Mallarmé)

DST.content: no rhythm w/out caesura > antirhythmic [Hölderlin], arrhythmic
DST.linkedContent: no rhythm w/out caesura > antirhythmic [Hölderlin], arrhythmic

DST.content: interrupts alternation, constraint of opposition, even double bind [cf. p. 225]
DST.linkedContent: interrupts alternation, constraint of opposition, even double bind [cf. p. 225]

DST.content: Lacoue-Labarthe: caesura is empty moment, intrusion of prophetic word (Tiresias)
DST.linkedContent: Lacoue-Labarthe: caesura is empty moment, intrusion of prophetic word (Tiresias)

DST.content: caesura marks withdrawal of divine, plays at & undoes mourning > doubles work of mourning (the speculative, the dialectic, the opposition, the identification, the nostalgic interiorization, even the double bind of imitation), caesura takes one’s breath away (coupe le souffle), open mouth, pour donner, pour recevoir: quand elle a de la chance, gives one speech
DST.linkedContent: caesura marks withdrawal of divine, plays at & undoes mourning > doubles work of mourning (the speculative, the dialectic, the opposition, the identification, the nostalgic interiorization, even the double bind of imitation), caesura takes one’s breath away (coupe le souffle), open mouth, pour donner, pour recevoir: quand elle a de la chance, gives one speech

DST.content: unavoidable resistance to désistance as nonpathological inhibition, no rhythm w/out it, can say the same about the double bind (see p. 228 return to father, subject to law as inhibition, defense) [a safeguarding, a filiation, a subjectivity compelled by the caesura?]
DST.linkedContent: unavoidable resistance to désistance as nonpathological inhibition, no rhythm w/out it, can say the same about the double bind (see p. 228 return to father, subject to law as inhibition, defense) [a safeguarding, a filiation, a subjectivity compelled by the caesura?]

IW.content: Rosenzweig associates abyss w/ volcanic fire (eruption), convulsive tremor marking rhythm of flow of lava—tempo of discontinuous rhetoric
IW.linkedContent: Rosenzweig associates abyss w/ volcanic fire (eruption), convulsive tremor marking rhythm of flow of lava—tempo of discontinuous rhetoric

D.content: Sollers: “we are dancing on a volcano”
“I”: passing passageway for permutation, repercussive percussion, full force of writing > d’un coup, triggers (déclenche) tale & keeps (maintient) it in progress
D.linkedContent: “I”: passing passageway for permutation, repercussive percussion, full force of writing > d’un coup, triggers (déclenche) tale & keeps (maintient) it in progress

D.content: simulacrum [of “I”] as a force, le simulacre de l’assistance: chambre obscure: feigns to transform the imperfect into present: impossible > et vous entraîne dans un nouveau vertige
D.linkedContent: simulacrum [of “I”] as a force, le simulacre de l’assistance: chambre obscure: feigns to transform the imperfect into present: impossible > et vous entraîne dans un nouveau vertige

D.content: [re: melody in Numbers] in all senses of word, it’s a cadence you must follow
D.linkedContent: [re: melody in Numbers] in all senses of word, it’s a cadence you must follow

D.content: authorless voice, phonic tracing no ideal signified could stamp [sa frappe sensible] sans reste, all representative outcroppings (affleurements) subjected to rhythm of a numerous pounding
D.linkedContent: authorless voice, phonic tracing no ideal signified could stamp [sa frappe sensible] sans reste, all representative outcroppings (affleurements) subjected to rhythm of a numerous pounding

D.content: splayed square, triangle open on 4th side, loosens obsidionality of triangle and circle, whose ternary rhythm (Trinity, Oedipus, Dialectics) governs metaphysics
D.linkedContent: splayed square, triangle open on 4th side, loosens obsidionality of triangle and circle, whose ternary rhythm (Trinity, Oedipus, Dialectics) governs metaphysics

+R.content: survival movement, arrêt de mort, final trance, sursaut cambré tenu au mors: says “I” (am dead) or hoc est corpus meum > dominant fish, one that bites best, takes from sea a body of scaly writing, homogenous w/ signatory’s initials
+R.linkedContent: survival movement, arrêt de mort, final trance, sursaut cambré tenu au mors: says “I” (am dead) or hoc est corpus meum > dominant fish, one that bites best, takes from sea a body of scaly writing, homogenous w/ signatory’s initials

+R.content: death dance in fish’s tail (queue) > rhythmos: cadence of writing, undulation of waves
+R.linkedContent: death dance in fish’s tail (queue) > rhythmos: cadence of writing, undulation of waves

C.content: arithmetic compulsion and la narration comptable in Sade’s 120 Days, part of the fun > its regular cadence, rhythmic operation: to excrete excrement, swallow it, en escompter la jouissance
C.linkedContent: arithmetic compulsion and la narration comptable in Sade’s 120 Days, part of the fun > its regular cadence, rhythmic operation: to excrete excrement, swallow it, en escompter la jouissance

LI.content: associating non-present w/ restance adds spectacular blinking-effect to warning light: rhythm of blinking essential to mark
LI.linkedContent: associating non-present w/ restance adds spectacular blinking-effect to warning light: rhythm of blinking essential to mark

TN.content: syncope of heartbeat gives rhythm to pulse or haptical compulsion: the cum of con-tact, a link where disconnection remains at work
TN.linkedContent: syncope of heartbeat gives rhythm to pulse or haptical compulsion: the cum of con-tact, a link where disconnection remains at work

TN.content: you, metronome of my heteronomy, you resist my dreams of a reappropriating movement of self-presence, self-consciousness, absolute knowledge, which is why I love you, so painfully, at heart of pleasure itself
TN.linkedContent: you, metronome of my heteronomy, you resist my dreams of a reappropriating movement of self-presence, self-consciousness, absolute knowledge, which is why I love you, so painfully, at heart of pleasure itself

TN.content: you break me from dialectic (which does not exclude it)
TN.linkedContent: you break me from dialectic (which does not exclude it)

SPEC.content: [re: Freud’s Beyond…] to guard one’s fashion, one’s rhythm, what counts is less telos than rhythm of differance, speed of the step: Zauderrythmus (differential rhythm)
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: Freud’s Beyond…] to guard one’s fashion, one’s rhythm, what counts is less telos than rhythm of differance, speed of the step: Zauderrythmus (differential rhythm)

SPEC.content: fort:da, pleasure is a kind of rhythm [Nietzsche], SPEC will have played fort:da of Nietzsche, the limping (boitement) of unterwegs, a step forward for nothing, only rhythm
SPEC.linkedContent: fort:da, pleasure is a kind of rhythm [Nietzsche], SPEC will have played fort:da of Nietzsche, the limping (boitement) of unterwegs, a step forward for nothing, only rhythm

SPEC.content: poem of limping consoles for too slow step of science
SPEC.linkedContent: poem of limping consoles for too slow step of science

SPEC.content: death drive doesn’t work in silence (like in French translation), but goes unnoticed (unauffällig), has to do w/ time (link to Kant, Aristotle)—thus rhythm: do feelings of tension exist to distinguish btwn bound/unbound energy or do they exist in relation to absolute magnitude?
SPEC.linkedContent: death drive doesn’t work in silence (like in French translation), but goes unnoticed (unauffällig), has to do w/ time (link to Kant, Aristotle)—thus rhythm: do feelings of tension exist to distinguish btwn bound/unbound energy or do they exist in relation to absolute magnitude?

CHOR.content: how can one breathe w/out punctuation, w/out multiplicities of rhythm, steps, how can one dance?
CHOR.linkedContent: how can one breathe w/out punctuation, w/out multiplicities of rhythm, steps, how can one dance?
